column2: The advancement of medicine has led to the development of proper pharmaceuticals, especially those using opiates, as a method of medical treatment replacing more traditional methods.
This plant creates modern medicines by synthesizing new chemical compounds from opium.

Enacting this decision will permanently disable Province Selector decisions for all players. This decision is only available in the first month of the game.
Enacting this decision will permanently disable Province Selector decisions for all players. This decision is only available in the first month of the game.
Signing the Geneva Convention will trigger an invention that gives +10% military hospital modifier.
Gives your country an extra immigrant attraction modifier for 3 years. This modifier is not enough to overcome the non New World penalty to immigration.
Gives a countrywide -0.3 modifier to emigration for 2 years. For reference, 5 militancy gives +0.2 modifier to emigration and 10 militancy gives a 1.0 modifier to emigration.
Raises your draft law by one level. If your government type is a fascist or communist dictatorship, or you are currently involved in a great war, the draft law will skip to service by requirement.
Raises your draft law by one level. If you have a fascist government or are currently involved in a great war, the draft law will skip to service by requirement.
Gives a -0.03 MIL and CON modifier to the country for 10 years.
Reduces infamy by 2.5 and gives a 5 year cooldown.

Changes countrywide POP ideology by +25% for the chosen ideology.
Changes countrywide POP ideology by +25% for the chosen ideology.
Increases the chance of your POPs promoting to soldiers. This does not raise the max soldier cap per province. Only revanchism can raise the maximum soldier cap in non colonial states above 5%.
Gives cores to selected state. POPs cannot assimilate unless they are living in cored provinces.

Increases the literacy of the selected state. The amount of literacy gained is dependent on the size of the state. States less than 350K get 2% literacy, states between 350K and 1M get 17.5%, states over 1M get 15%. Can only use on the same state once every 15 years.

Adds a 300% assimilation rate bonus to the given state for 10 years. Cannot use on colonial states. Assimilation rate and assimilation chance are different variables, if a POPs assimilation chance is 0 it will not assimilate. Hover your mouse over the nationality of a POP in the population tab to see its individual assimilation chance.
Gives a -0.15 MIL and CON modifier to the selected state for 10 years.
Gives a small growth modifier to the selected state for several years. Cannot use on states with over 500k POP
Province Scope: Blood and Iron RGO.
Gives a permanent RGO efficiency bonus and +0.02 militancy modifier to the selected province. Cannot use on gold mines.
Gives a permanent boost to farm and mining size to the selected province.

Allows the switching of a single RGO province of the following types: Coal, Iron, and Sulphur can only be swapped with each other and NOT from timber. Timber can be swapped from any agricultural tile and requires a forest, woods, or jungle province. Do not switch to timber if its demand in the world market isn't high otherwise the province will get stuck with 0% employment. Gives a 50% output debuff for 12.5 years. You will receive a rebate of 750, 500, 250, or 0 AP for provinces with <35K, <100k, <300k, and >300k population respectively.

Allows the switching of a single RGO province of the following types: Grain, Fruit, Fish, Cattle, Wool, Cotton, Opium, Dye, Silk, or Tobacco. Fish requires a coastal province. Gives a 50% output debuff for 12.5 years. You will receive a rebate of 750, 500, 250, or 0 AP for provinces with <35K, <100k, <300k, and >300k population respectively.
Destroys one province selector and refunds 1000 Admin Points

Choose to change a province to the following RGO types. Coal, Iron, and Sulphur can only be swapped with each other and NOT from timber. Timber can be swapped from any agricultural tile and requires a forest, woods, or jungle province.

Your annual administrative point budget has increased.
Pick the political path your country will follow.
The effects of the recruitment drive have worn off and people are returning to civilian life.

Welcome to the tutorial of Victoria Universalis. The goal of this mod is to introduce more features to play tall, give the player more control, to provide a challenging single player experience while still being balanced for multiplayer, and to be as light weight as possible so as to not slow down the game too much. To that end, balance and meaningful gameplay additions are prioritized over everything else. Decisions with clear instructions on how to trigger them have replaced most random events. A few big things are included from other mods, namely reforms from HPM, country size modifiers and RGO change decisions from PUIR, and a few art assets from PDM. If you want to end the tutorial, select the first option, if you wish to know more pick the second.
I would like to know more.

To use the new decisions, you must first build a Province Selector (PS) building. Country Scope decisions don't care where the PS is built, State Scope decisions will target all provinces in a random state that has a PS, and Province Scope decisions will affect a random province that contains the PS. After enacting each decision, the PS used in the decision will be destroyed. PS require Administrative Points (AP) to build. You receive a base stipend of 50 AP per year and can increase this amount by researching the Economic Thought line of techs. AP cannot be produced by any other means and it is represented by the book icon in the trade window. If you do not wish to play with this feature, you can disable it by enacting the "Disable Province Selector" decision. This decision is only available in the first month of the game.
I would like to know more.

All assimilation factors in the base game were scrapped and remade from the ground up. POPs now have the same small chance to assimilate that is affected by lifeneeds, literacy, and militancy. This chance is quadrupled in POPs located in provinces without their culture core and then quadrupled again in New World nation provinces, so a POP located in the New World could potentially have 16x higher assimilation chance than one living in the Old World. Your ruling party's citizenship policy also has a large effect on assimilation rate.
I would like to know more.

A new revanchism comeback mechanic has been introduced. Every 5 points of revanchism now increases both your mobilization pool and maximum solder cap in cored states by 0.5%, capped up to 5% each. Your country gains revanchism by losing core territory, and it is calculated by number of provinces lost not by population lost. You can view your current revanchism by looking in the political tab next to your government type.
I would like to know more.

Poor strata POP demotion from unemployment has been nerfed and POP promotion has been buffed to compensate. This makes literacy and national foci use the main drivers of industrialization rather than massive RGO unemployment that occurs in the lategame.
I would like to know more.

A number of small changes have been made in an effort to balance the in-game economy and lessen the frequency of economic crashes. New factory goods have been introduced and POP needs have been rebalanced to make normally useless goods more important. Governments will be forced to pay money to POPs through social spending in order to get pop growth. This has the effect of taking money out of national banks and back into the world market.
I would like to know more.

Land combat has been balanced so that lategame artillery only has roughly only twice as much defense as attack, as opposed to four to one in vanilla. Guards and tanks have been buffed to be better than infantry in every aspect, but their costs have increased substantially to compensate. Wooden ship HP has been cut in half and navy stats on all late game ships have been changed to create a balanced combat system. In vanilla, all cruiser fleets would wreck big ships due to their extremely efficient naval supply cost, evasion, and torpedo attacks. Cruisers torpedo attack has been taken away, battleship and dreadnought stats have been buffed. Commerce raiders get many torpedo attack bonuses from late game inventions but almost no normal attack. Torpedoes are a special type of attack that only affect big ships and do no damage to small ships, so the balance of lategame naval combat is Big ships > Cruisers > Commerce Raiders > Big Ships.
I would like to know more.

Healthcare reform is the primary way of growing your population and stabilizing the in game economy. The reforms are time locked, require certain techs to pass, and they have to be funded via the social spending slider. You get no pop growth benefit just by passing the reform, in order to receive the benefits of the reform you must have your social spending slider set to the minimum amount listed in the reform. The money spent on healthcare goes directly into the pockets of POPs, and in this way liquidity is increased in the market which leads to higher demand and higher prices for goods, which leads to more income for POPs.
I would like to know more.

The first thing you should do is max out national admin efficiency by promoting bureaucrats in your largest accepted culture POP states. Tariff efficiency, building costs, and POP promotion are based off your national admin efficiency. Try to not build Province Selectors until you have 100% admin efficiency since their cost is increased when your admin efficiency is below 100%. National admin efficiency DOES NOT CARE where the bureaucrats are, so its better to increase bureaucrats in your biggest state with accepted culture POPs well above 1% in order to get max national admin efficiency faster. State admin efficiency does not have any affect on POP promotion rates, tariffs, or taxes. The in game tooltip on state admin effiency is wrong, only national admin efficiency matters unless you're trying to turn a colony into a state.
I would like to know more.

The Hungarian Diet has grown increasingly independent of Austrian rule in recent years. Field Marshall Count Franz Philipp von Lamberg was sent to Hungary to take personal control over their armies, but was attacked upon his arrival. In response, the Austrian government ordered the Hungarian Diet dissolved and the Ban of Croatia installed in Lamberg's place. The Hungarians have refused to obey, and thus we now face civil war to maintain the integrity of the empire.

After the latest war our subjects in Poland and other parts of our empire began to grow restless. The uprising began as a spontaneous protest by young Poles against conscription into the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Army. It was soon joined by high-ranking Polish-Lithuanian officers and various politicians. In Warsaw alone 116 demonstrations were held in $YEAR$. Much of these manifestations in ended in clashes with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Army. In spite of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ police interference, a symbolic meeting of hymn-singing Poles and Lithuanians took place on the bridge across an important River. The crowds sang "God protect Poland" in Lithuanian and Belarusian. Earlier in $YEAR$ the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government introduced a state of emergency in Kovno and Grodno as well as several other Polish-majority provinces. Public gatherings were banned and some public leaders were declared outlaws. The situation threatens to break down in anarchy.
The German population explosion has ended.
There is much anger and resentment over the loss of Alsace Lorraine. Men are enlisting in droves for the chance to seek vengeance on our foes.
We will reclaim our rightful lands!
Now that $COUNTRY$ is a colonial power, it is time to decide a policy of how $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial lands will be administered.
Our people need more land to settle!
We shall rule our colonies through local rulers.
It is our burden to bring civilization to these lands.
Now that $COUNTRY$ is no longer a colonial power, it is time to reform the bureaucracy centered on the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ homeland.
Who needs a place in the sun anyways?
For too long our people have suffered Ottoman oppression. Let us finish what we started in the Serbian revolution and rid our lands of the Turk once and for all.
We have defeated the vile Ottoman scum and reclaimed our ancestral lands. Serbia will be great once more!
For too long our people have suffered Ottoman oppression. Let us finish what we started in the Greek revolution and rid our lands of the Turk once and for all.
We have defeated the vile Ottoman scum and reclaimed our ancestral lands. Greece will be great once more!
The Greek diaspora is returning to our lands in droves and the Turks are leaving either voluntarily or by force.
For too long our people have remained divided and under foreign rule. It is time we proclaimed a united kingdom of Romania!

The people are currently being indoctrinated. We must wait awhile before we start a new propaganda campaign.
We are justifying our aggression to the international court

We have increased the eligibility of our draft laws.
All resources in the country are being directed to war. The people make do with what little scraps they have in order to feed the army.

The Common Army was the name of the non-German military branch of the Austrian empire. As more cultures get accepted, the Common Army shrinks in order to represent the establishment of each ethnicity's independent army.

The Common Army was the name of the non-German military branch of the Austrian empire. As more cultures get accepted, the Common Army shrinks in order to represent the establishment of each ethnicity's independent army.

The Common Army was the name of the non-German military branch of the Austrian empire. As more cultures get accepted, the Common Army shrinks in order to represent the establishment of each ethnicity's independent army.

The Common Army was the name of the non-German military branch of the Austrian empire. As more cultures get equal status in the empire, the Common Army shrinks in order to represent the establishment of each ethnicity's independent army.
Christians must pay a jizya tax and are subject to conscription into Ottoman armies.

Despite the dissolution of the Janissaries during the Ausipcious Incident in 1826, the continued persecution and enslavement of christians continues. This discrimination must be stamped out in order to create a unified Ottoman state.
The Egyptian rebels have been crushed and are ready to submit to Ottoman rule once more.
Muhammad Ali has declared independence from the Sublime Porte and is threatening our holdings in Syria. We must act now if we are to re-establish Ottoman authority in Egypt and the Levant.

One of the early goals of the liberal reform movement in the Ottoman Empire was the creation of a new pan Ottoman identity that all cultures and religions could identify with. Historically, this idea was never realized as the Empire was destabilized by a series of disastrous wars, coups, and uprisings, however you have the option to change all that.
By establishing a dominant position on the Italian peninsula, we can secure a national homeland for our people by proclaiming ourselves the motive power of a unified Italian state.
By establishing a dominant position on the Italian peninsula, we can secure a national homeland for our people by proclaiming ourselves the motive power of a unified Italian state.
We have driven the Austrians out of Lombardia and are now the preeminent power in northern Italy. The rest of the north Italian kingdoms have agreed to unite under our leadership.
The Iberian kingdoms are ready to reunite under our banner.
The new equal status conferred to one of our minorities allows them to establish their own national army independent of the Common Army.

One of the main tenants of the newly formed German Confederation is to confer privileged status to ethnic Germans. We will have to abandon our hopes of creating a Danubian Confederation in order to appease our German brothers.

Focus on developing the South. You will still have the option to switch back.
Focus on developing the North. You will still have the option to switch back.

The current Argentinian constitution was drafted in 1853 and approved by all provincial governments despite a short lived revolt from Buenos Aires.  It was closely inspired by the juridical and political doctrines of the United States Federal Constitution, establishing for instance a Republican division of powers, a high level of independence for the provinces, and a federal power controlled by a strong executive government yet limited by a bicameral national congress.
A house divided against itself cannot stand. We will deal with the issue of slavery even if it means war.
This decision will trigger the Sepoy Rebellion event and cause an independence war to occur between all existing Indian puppets and Britain.
We must break British tyranny in India!
Lei Aurea, or the Golden Law, abolished slavery once and for all throughout Brazil. The law contained only two artices
column3: Slavery was to be abolished, and any previous ruling contradicting the first article was now void.

column2: Our armies are in disarray and cannot fight effectively
Our army is made up of mostly conscripted peasants and their fighting capability suffers as a result
There is nothing we desire of the outside world. The foreign barbarians are banned from entering the country or trading with us

This will trigger the Taiping Rebellion event and remove the Chinese Isolationism modifier. All armies will be reduced to 0 organization for 45 days to allow time for the Taiping rebels to mobilize. The Taiping Rebellion will trigger in 1860 if this decision is not enacted before then.
We have pushed the Egyptians out of the Levant and they are ready to sue for peace. Are we content with our holdings in the Middle East or do we press on and occupy all of Egypt?
We will settle for Syria and Palestine.
We will take back all of Egypt!
We have been pushed out of the Levant and the Ottomans are offering peace if we give up our claims in Syria and Palestine. Do we accept or do we continue the fight?
The Egyptians have agreed to give up their claims to Syria and Palestine in exchange for their independence.
The Egyptians have refused to give up their claims to Syria and Palestine.
Now we will make them give up their claims to Egypt as well!
We have to wait until the truce is over to justify another war with Egypt
